algorithm_technique: Start from top-right or bottom-left, use two pointers to efficiently count negatives in a sorted matrix.
problem_summary_simple: Count all negative numbers in a matrix sorted non-increasingly row and column-wise.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a two-pointer approach, starting from the top-right corner, to efficiently count negative numbers in O(m+n) time.
key_insights: The sorted nature of the matrix is key to the O(m+n) solution.
Starting from the top-right corner (or bottom-left) allows for a linear scan.
If an element is negative, all elements to its left in the same row are also negative (due to row-wise sorting).
